intro: Sericographis macedoana f. redacta, commonly known as the redacta form of the Macedonian sericographis, is a rare and specialized plant species. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, clustered flowers. It is typically found in specific microhabitats with moist, shaded conditions. Due to its limited distribution and unique morphology, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
